summary: "Les Misérables," written by Victor Hugo in 1862, is a famous French novel set between 1815 and 1832. It tells the story of Jean Valjean, an ex-convict seeking redemption. The book explores big themes like law, grace, history, politics, and love. It's been made into many movies, TV shows, and a popular musical. People often just call it by its original French title, which means "The Miserable Ones."
title: Les Misérables
